name: William E. BROWN and Mary E. Brown, his wife, Appellants, v. Henry P. LENCER and Catherine E. Lencer, his wife

judges: Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: William E. BROWN and Mary E. Brown, his wife, Appellants, v. Henry P. LENCER and Catherine E. Lencer, his wife.

opinions.text:
PER CURIAM:
Decree affirmed. Case remanded to the court below for certification to the law side of the court. Each party to bear own costs.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Robert C. Hillen, Kachulis, Copetas, Adams & Hillen, Pittsburgh, for appellants.
Arnold E. Dolby, Ralph L. S. Montana, Clarion, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
330 A.2d 833
William E. BROWN and Mary E. Brown, his wife, Appellants, v. Henry P. LENCER and Catherine E. Lencer, his wife.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 10, 1974.
Decided Jan. 27, 1975.
Robert C. Hillen, Kachulis, Copetas, Adams & Hillen, Pittsburgh, for appellants.
Arnold E. Dolby, Ralph L. S. Montana, Clarion, for appellees.
Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
